DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the cross-sectional prevalence of the metabolic syndrome in patients with schizophrenia taking antipsychotics.
DOC.brief_title: Prevalence of the Metabolic Syndrome in SPR Taking Antipsychotics
DOC.detailed_description: Schizophrenic patients taking any kind of antipsychotics for at least 1 year at the Seoul National Hospital will be participated in this study. we are planning to enroll approximately 1000 patients with schizophrenia. For each subject - abdominal circumference - body mass index - lipid profile : TG, HDL-chlo, total chol - systolic/diastolic blood pressure - fasting blood glucose will be measured. we will calculate the rates of patients who meet the criteria for the Metabolic syndrome. 1. Abdominal obesity : absolute criteria 2. 2 or more of followings 1. Triglyceride ≥ 150mg/dL or ongoing treatment 2. HDL-cholesterol ＜ 40mg/dL (men) HDL-cholesterol ＜ 50mg/dL (female) or ongoing treatment 3. Hypertension 130mmHg ≥ systolic 85mmHg ≥ diastolic or ongoing treatment 4. FBS ≥ 100mg/dL or previous diagnosis of type II DM
DOC.criteria: Patients taking a same antipsychotics at least more than one year schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder
